definitions.definition: A summons to arms, as on the approach of an enemy.
Any sound or information intended to give notice of approaching danger; a warning sound to arouse attention; a warning of danger.
Sudden surprise with fear or terror excited by apprehension of danger; in the military use, commonly, sudden apprehension of being attacked by surprise.
A mechanical device for awaking people, or rousing their attention.
definitions.example: The clock radio is a friendlier version of the cold alarm by the bedside.

definitions.definition: An instance of an alarm ringing, beeping or clanging, to give a noise signal at a certain time.
definitions.example: You should set the alarm on your watch to go off at seven o'clock.

definitions.definition: To call to arms for defense
To give (someone) notice of approaching danger
To rouse to vigilance and action; to put on the alert.
To surprise with apprehension of danger; to fill with anxiety in regard to threatening evil; to excite with sudden fear.
To keep in excitement; to disturb.
